results.title: Buster Keaton : a hard act to follow
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton is now regarded as one of the supreme comedians of the silent American cinema. He was also an inventive and dedicated film-maker who performed all of his own stunts yet took little interest in business arrangements. This is a comprehensive survey of Buster Keaton’s life and work including generous extracts from all his feature films and most of his two-reelers. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson. Ep. 1. (53 min.)—Ep. 2. (54 min.)—Ep. 3. (53 min.) Further reference: http://www.busterkeaton.com

results.title: Bushfire moon
results.brief_description: It’s the week before Christmas, 1891. The Australian bush is tinder dry as a fierce drought brings an infant nation to its knees. When eight year old Ned O’Day mistakes a roguish ex-miner for Father Christmas, Ned’s firm belief and sense of wonder bring about a startling turn of events. Stars John Waters and Dee Wallace.

results.title: Bush pilot: reflections on a Canadian myth
results.creator_credit: Bob Lower, Norma Bailey, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For some bush pilots, flying is like playing solo violin at Carnegie Hall. For others, it’s like driving a taxi. This film shows how bush pilots are slowly being replaced. In northern towns built by bulldozers and jet aircraft, the emphasis is not on adapting to the north, but on remaking it in the image of the south. This is a thought provoking film about northern development.

results.title: Bush Mechanics
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Francis Jupurrula Kelly, Jennifer McMahon, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Film Australia and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description: The “Bush Mechanics” comprise of a group of five young Warlpiri Aboriginal men from Yuendumu in the Northern Territory who can face any challenge when it comes to fixing cars, no matter what condition the car may be in! They will use the bush as a resource for spare parts and do whatever it takes to keep a car on the road. Their clever inventiveness, wonderfully offbeat humour and crazy antics, provide an insight into both contemporary and traditional Aboriginal culture. In the style of a road movie, this series follows the “Bush Mechanics” across the central desert, through their many mechanical mishaps, challenges and exploits, including the race to Willowra to play their first paying gig as a rock band, the travel to Alice Springs to collect Simeon’s nephew from jail, the chase for their stolen car and finally covering thousands of kilometers across the west to Broome to search for pearl shells for the rainmaker. The Bush Mechanics are: Simeon Jupurrula Ross, Steven Jupurrula Morton, Errol Jupurrula Nelson, Junior Jupurrula Wilson and Randall Jupurrula Wilson. Also features Jack Jakamurra Ross, and Francis Jupurrula Kelly. In English and Warlpiri with English subtitles.

results.title: Bush mechanics
results.creator_credit: David Batty, Francis Kelly, Tom Kantor and Waripiri Media
results.brief_description: A documentary that takes a light-hearted look at the ingenious methods that Aboriginal men living in remote communities employ to keep their automobiles running. Without a trade certificate between them, these men have developed the unique craft of ‘bush mechanics’, adapting available resources for use as spare parts. The stories they relate provide a unique insight into this practical and philosophical approach to car maintenance and highlight many of the adaptive techniques desert people have developed through necessity over the last seventy years.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Batty, Francis Kelly, Tom Kantor and Waripiri Media

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Gilda Baracchi, Paul D. Barron and Barron Films
results.brief_description: It’s nearly Christmas and a group of children embark on a courageous and exciting adventure to rescue their stolen horse in time to take part in the big country race on New Year’s Day. This timeless story is a wonderful Australian film filled with adventure, comedy and a dash of romance. Stars Nicole Kidman and John Howard.

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Bush Christmas is a superb film which won critical acclaim around the world upon its release in 1947 and is today regarded as an Australian classic. In this 1971 re-edited version, a family of Australian children, realising their father’s horses have been stolen, set out to track the horse thieves and return the horses to their father as a Christmas present. A storm destroys their tracks and the children become lost, while search parties, and the horse thieves, desperately hunt for them. Starring Chips Rafferty.

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.creator_credit: Graeme Clifford, John Sexton, Australian Film Investment Corporation, Hoyts Edgley and Michael Thomas
results.brief_description:
An epic journey from a turbulent chapter in Australia’s past, ‘Burke and Wills’ is the story of the explorers Burke and Wills’ expedition across the Australian continent in 1860. Jack Thompson is Robert O’Hara Burke, a strong Irishman obsessed with the desire to ‘write the map’; Nigel Havers is William John Wills, the archetypal Victorian gentleman explorer.

The film explores the changing relationship between the two men as they struggle with the harsh Australian environment they are attempting to chart.

results.title: Burke's Backyard How to Create a Beaut Backyard
results.brief_description: Features selections from the best of “Burke’s Backyard” segments and looks at the basics of creating your own Shangrila. Designed for the whole family, the video takes the viewer through the tips and hints you need to know to create your own private paradise.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! [text]
results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Accompanying student text for the audio and video programs in Italian for beginners, “Buongiorno Italia!”. Contains the text of the videos, exercises, reading passages, a key to the exercises, grammar and a glossary.
